description: From Middle English sclabbe, slabbe, of uncertain origin; possibly from *slap, related to dialectal slappel (“portion, piece”), along with slape (“slippery”), sleip (“smooth piece of timber”), borrowed through Old Norse sleipr from Proto-Germanic *slaipaz, from Proto-Indo-European *(s)leyb-.  See also Norwegian sleip (“slippery”) and Icelandic sleipur.

entries.meaning: A large, flat piece of solid material; a solid object that is large and flat.
examples: There were no windows in the inn. They were not required, since the interstices between the slabs suffered the wind, the rain, and the light of day to penetrate simultaneously.

entries.meaning: (Australia) A carton containing 24 cans (chiefly of beer). [from 20th c.]
examples: The Australians murder a few slabs of beer and the New Zealanders murder a few vowels.

entries.meaning: An outside piece taken from a log or timber when sawing it into boards, planks, etc.
(nautical) The slack part of a sail.
(US, slang) A large, luxury pre-1980 General Motors vehicle, particularly a Buick, Oldsmobile, or Cadillac.

examples: After being towed into a massive slab, Dorian dropped down the face and caught a rail, putting him in a near-impossible situation.

entries.meaning: (computing) A sequence of 12 adjacent bits, serving as a byte in some computers.
(computing) The amount by which a cache can grow or shrink, used in memory allocation.
(geology) Part of a tectonic plate that is being, or has been, subducted.
examples: Being driven by the gravitational force, the subducting Pacific slab continues to sink down to the boundary between the upper and lower mantle  […]

entries.meaning: (construction) A poured-concrete foundation for a building.

verbs.description: slab (third-person singular simple present slabs, present participle slabbing, simple past and past participle slabbed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make something into a slab.

description: Compare Goidelic and Irish slaib (“mud, mire left on a river strand”), and English slop (“puddle”).

adjectives.description: slab (comparative more slab, superlative most slab)

description: Acronym of Slow, Loud And Bangin'. This term been popularized through the southern rap genre of hip-hop, most notably by rappers such as Paul Wall, Chamillionaire, Lil' Keke, and others.

entries.meaning: (Southern US, slang) A car that has been modified with equipment such as loudspeakers, lights, special paint, hydraulics, and other accessories.
examples: Pull me over, try to check my slab

entries.meaning: (British dialect, obsolete) A bird, the wryneck.
